Public Member Functions

pure subroutine tridi_solver (center_diag, up_diag, down_diag, right_hand_side, conc, ncell)
 Solves a tridiagonal system. This sub-routine was taken from the Numerical Recipes in Fortran, page 43 (Edition of 1992)

Detailed Description

Matrix solver module for the system of linear equations. The solvers include:

  • Tri-diagonal solver using todo:? Thomas algorithm
  • Penta-diagonal solver using todo:? algorithm
  • Sparse matrix solver

Member Function/Subroutine Documentation

real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(out)  conc,
integer, intent(in)  ncell 
)

Solves a tridiagonal system. This sub-routine was taken from the Numerical Recipes in Fortran, page 43 (Edition of 1992)

[B1,C1,00,00,00] [X1,X2,...] [A2,B2,C2,00,00] = [D1,D2,....] [00,A3,B3,C3,00] [00,00,A4,B4,C4] [00,00,00,A5,B5]

Variables:

A(i): Values of the coefficients below diagonal in matrix B(i): Values of the coefficients at the diagonal in matrix C(i): Values of the coefficients above diagonal in matrix D(i): Values of the right hand side vector X(i): Values of the computed solution

Parameters:
[in]ncellNumber of volumes
[out]concValues of the computed solution
[in]down_diagValues of the coefficients below diagonal in matrix
[in]center_diagValues of the coefficients at the diagonal in matrix
[in]up_diagValues of the coefficients above the diagonal in matrix
[in]right_hand_sideValues of the right hand side vector
